image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from Indiana; born in Cincinnati, Hamilton County, Ohio, October 17, 1932; graduated from the Darrow School, New Lebanon, N.Y., 1946-1950; A.B., Princeton University, Princeton, N.J., 1954; B.D., Union Theological Seminary, New York, N.Y., 1957; clergyman, ordained in Rochester, N.Y., 1957; member, Indianapolis, Ind., board of public safety, 1970-1972; elected as a Republican to the Ninety-third Congress (January 3, 1973-January 3, 1975); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the Ninety-fourth Congress in 1974; mayor, Indianapolis, Ind., 1976-1991; mayor, Chevy Chase, Md., 2004-2006; died on December 18, 2016, in Chevy Chase, Md.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: Hudnutt, William H., III, et al. The Hudnut Years in Indianapolis, 1976-1991. Bloomington, IN: Indiana University Press, 1995.

researchRecord.name: In the Susan McWhirter Ostrom, Papers, 1843-1980, 22 boxes.
1972-1974, 51 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: The papers of William Herbert Hudnut II contain congressional papers and correspondence, including reports, materials relating to his committee work and to national and state issues, campaign files, patronage recommendations, invitations, appointments, and constituent correspondence of his administrative assistant. A finding aid is available in the repository. Restricted.
